articles.headline: Sobering Inflation Report Dampens Biden’s Claims of Economic Progress
articles.snippet: The president is trying once again to accentuate the positives in the recovery from recession, but stubbornly high prices are complicating the message.
articles.abstract: The president is trying once again to accentuate the positives in the recovery from recession, but stubbornly high prices are complicating the message.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden gathered with top Democrats at the White House on Tuesday to celebrate their inflation fight at an inopportune moment, as a sobering new report showed just how far the economy still has to go to bring soaring consumer prices under control.

articles.headline: In Reclaimed Towns, Ukrainians Recount a Frantic Russian Retreat
articles.snippet: Residents of towns recently retaken by Ukraine described a chaotic flight by disorganized Russian troops, suggesting morale and inexperience remain major problems for Russia.
articles.abstract: Residents of towns recently retaken by Ukraine described a chaotic flight by disorganized Russian troops, suggesting morale and inexperience remain major problems for Russia.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALAKLIYA, Ukraine — The signs of desperation were everywhere. Abandoned military vehicles. Cans of food and dishes left on tables. Mail scattered on office floors. Clothes left hanging on lines.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Jeffrey Gettleman

articles.headline: Republicans Struggle to Unite Party Around National Abortion Restrictions
articles.snippet: A new proposal was intended to align Republicans on abortion policy before the midterm elections. It only exposed divisions.
articles.abstract: A new proposal was intended to align Republicans on abortion policy before the midterm elections. It only exposed divisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: For weeks, anti-abortion activists and their Republican allies have been quietly seeking to rally their party around a single platform on abortion, hoping to settle divisions and blunt political damage from an issue with growing potency in the midterm elections.
articles.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Elizabeth Dias

articles.headline: How a Spreader of Voter Fraud Conspiracy Theories Became a Star
articles.snippet: For more than a decade, Catherine Engelbrecht, a Texas mom turned election-fraud crusader, has sown doubts about ballots and voting. Her patience has paid off.
articles.abstract: For more than a decade, Catherine Engelbrecht, a Texas mom turned election-fraud crusader, has sown doubts about ballots and voting. Her patience has paid off.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2011, Catherine Engelbrecht appeared at a Tea Party Patriots convention in Phoenix to deliver a dire warning.

articles.headline: Ostracized by the West, Russia Finds a Partner in Saudi Arabia
articles.snippet: The two oil-producing countries have extended their partnership even as the United States and Europe have sought to punish and isolate Russia for invading Ukraine.
articles.abstract: The two oil-producing countries have extended their partnership even as the United States and Europe have sought to punish and isolate Russia for invading Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Russia massed troops on its border with Ukraine and invaded the country at the start of the year, Saudi Arabia’s Kingdom Holding Company quietly invested more than $600 million in Russia’s three dominant energy companies.
